item.description:
Weather permitting Pat plans to hit Liberty and Flume via
Liberty Spring and Franconia Ridge Trail.

This is a moderate~7.5 hours.

Please see http://home.earthlink... for description.
I expect some sort of traction will be necessary along the ridge between Liberty and Flume. Virtually all of this hike will be below treeline, however Mt Liberty and Flume should offer spectacular views.

Recent reports indicate the snowline is quite high up at about 3800 feet or so (http://www.viewsfromt... t=29864). There's a 1.1 mile walk along Franconia Ridge
between summits (2.2 round trip), so if there is snow it will cover ~25% of the mileage for the day.

I'd like to keep the group to 8-10 people.

If interested, please respond or email Pat at
Let's meet up at 9 am on 5/16 at the parking lot for Flume Visitor Center off US 3.


More info: http://www.summitpost...

Hope you'll join us!
Pat
item.name: Liberty and Flume via Liberty Spring and Franconia Ridge Trail
